meanings.definition: A small, fleshy projection on the mouthparts of an insect.
meanings.sent1: The labella of the mosquito help it to taste food.
meanings.sent2: The labella of the bee are used for feeding on nectar.
meanings.sent3: The ant thought the labella of the fly looked like tiny fingers.
meanings.sent4: The labella of the butterfly delicately touched the flower petals.
meanings.sent5: The labella of the moth were as sensitive as a cat's whiskers.

meanings.definition: The outer lip of the aperture of a gastropod shell.
meanings.sent1: The labella of the snail shell was smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent2: The labella of the conch shell spiraled gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The hermit crab mistook the labella of the shell for a welcome mat.
meanings.sent4: The labella of the shell whispered secrets of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The labella of the shell gleamed like a pearl in the sand.

meanings.definition: The petals of a flower collectively.
meanings.sent1: The labella of the rose were a vibrant red.
meanings.sent2: The labella of the daisy danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The labella of the tulip tickled the bee's nose.
meanings.sent4: The labella of the sunflower reached for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The labella of the orchid were as delicate as a butterfly's wings.
